comment: Professor Spadafora was one of the best teachers I have ever had. Everything she discusses pertains to the work assigned: only one paper per unit, and she is very open to giving feedback before the assignment is due! She was very kind and helpful, all of her lectures were very interesting, and she provided knowledge used outside of class!

Very fast lectures that do not give you time to keep up but posts ppts online that are locked and you need codes (Smart). No in-class tests just very long and extremely detailed unit essay take-home test (sounds better than it is) very heavy material and teaches class as if it was a higher level class in the major than it needs/meant to be.

She is very flexible when things are due and will extend the due date if she feels we did not have enough time. She is very passionate about her job and an easy A if you show up to class and read.  If you do not like reading and writing responses then do not take her class. I actually enjoyed the readings and did fairly well on all the writings.

She's very sweet, but she does not know how to teach an intro class. Assigned heavy reading every week, but it was very hard to read. She taught it as  more of a major class than an intro class. Very hard to keep up and gave quizzes over the reading. She talks extremely fast and barely explains. I'm an A/B student and I had to withdraw.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: If you don't like reading, do not take this class. Prof. Spadafora relies heavily on reading and lots of it, although the material is interesting, its very dense and sometimes hard to follow because of vocabulary.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Did not need a textbook and she only gives 1 test in the beginning of the class. Final is a paper/project but you have lots of time throughout semester to do it. She assigns lots of LONG readings with some discussion forums that count as quizzes. Shes a bit odd, but the only problem I had with her is she isnt super clear on instructions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took this class because it seemed interesting and wanted to learn more about it. I would say this class should be taken by people who are truly passionate about anthropology (even as an introductory class). Prof Spadafora is pretty cool and really passionate but not that great at teaching. She assigns a lot of readings and quizzes us on them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She cannot teach. She is a very VERY biased professor who preaches on having no bias. She does not teach this class as an intro class. The subject is interesting, but just beware of spedafora.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is very passionate about anthropology which is good but she takes it too seriously for an intro class full of mostly people that do not care at all about it. I have more work in that class than any other class. She expects us to love it as much as she does.  Unless you are majoring in Anth I do not suggest taking her for a social science credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I would take her again. Very understanding that it was only an introductory level course and cared deeply for subject. Reading was online, but she encouraged attendance, and it really did help with understanding the material if you were there for lectures. Also willing to work with students if you showed up to class regularly. Offered extra credit.

It felt more like all we did was discuss the readings she gave us (which were very long and stuffy and not at all fun or easy to read) and I don't feel as though I really learned anything about anthropology. Also, the final was more along the lines of what should be given in an advanced course, not an intro course.  No textbook, lots of articles.

She reads straight from the paragraphs on her powerpoints and reads insanely fast. She does post them though. She tends to get off track and voice her beliefs and opinions a lot. She does post all your readings online so you don't need to buy a text book. There is a LOT of reading each class. The class is very work heavy. Assignments due weekly.
